intro: Curatella imperialis, commonly known as the imperial curatella, is a tropical tree belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with humid climates. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
